references.reason: This paper introduces derivative-based global sensitivity measures (DGSMs), which are the central focus of the current research.

references.paper_title: Estimation of the derivative-based global sensitivity measures using a Gaussian process metamodel
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant because it proposes using Gaussian processes (GPs) to estimate DGSMs in situations involving expensive black-box functions, providing a method that is directly applied in the current study.
This paper serves as a foundational introduction to sensitivity analysis, providing the theoretical background upon which the current research builds.

references.paper_title: Near-optimal sensor placements in Gaussian processes: Theory, efficient algorithms and empirical studies
references.reason: This paper presents efficient active learning algorithms for Gaussian processes, offering methods that are directly relevant to the active learning approach adopted in the present study.
This book provides a comprehensive overview of global sensitivity analysis (GSA), a field in which the current research is situated, thus providing a foundational context.
